greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Largest b such that 1/n=1/c+1/b has integer solutions with c>b.
link: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 2..10000
formula: a(n) = n + 1 if and only if n is prime. (End)
example: a(10)=15 since 1/10=1/20+1/20=1/30+1/15=1/35+1/14=1/60+1/12=1/110+1/11, but the first sum does not have c>b, leaving the second sum to provide the value.
maple: if n*b mod (b-n) = 0 then return b fi
results.author: _Henry Bottomley_, Jul 23 2001
